eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.views.overlay

Class TilesOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.views.overlay.Overlay
      • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.views.overlay.SafeDrawOverlay
        • eu.trentorise.smartcampus.osm.android.views.overlay.TilesOverlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOverlayMenuProvider, OverlayConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MinimapOverlay

    public class TilesOverlay
extends SafeDrawOverlay
implements IOverlayMenuProvider
    These objects are the principle consumer of map tiles. see MapTile for an overview of how tiles are acquired by this overlay.

        public void setUseDataConnection(boolean aMode)
        Set whether to use the network connection if it's available.
        Parameters:
        aMode - if true use the network connection if it's available. if false don't use the network connection even if it's available.

      • drawTiles

        public void drawTiles(Canvas c,
             int zoomLevel,
             int tileSizePx,
             Rect viewPort)
        This is meant to be a "pure" tile drawing function that doesn't take into account osmdroid-specific characteristics (like osmdroid's canvas's having 0,0 as the center rather than the upper-left corner). Once the tile is ready to be drawn, it is passed to onTileReadyToDraw where custom manipulations can be made before drawing the tile.

      • setOptionsMenuEnabled

      • getLoadingBackgroundColor

        public int getLoadingBackgroundColor()

      • setLoadingBackgroundColor

        public void setLoadingBackgroundColor(int pLoadingBackgroundColor)
        Set the color to use to draw the background while we're waiting for the tile to load.
        Parameters:
        pLoadingBackgroundColor - the color to use. If the value is Color.TRANSPARENT then there will be no loading tile.

      • getLoadingLineColor

        public int getLoadingLineColor()

      • setLoadingLineColor

        public void setLoadingLineColor(int pLoadingLineColor)

      • setOvershootTileCache

        public void setOvershootTileCache(int overshootTileCache)
        Set this to overshoot the tile cache. By default the TilesOverlay only creates a cache large enough to hold the minimum number of tiles necessary to draw to the screen. Setting this value will allow you to overshoot the tile cache and allow more tiles to be cached. This increases the memory usage, but increases drawing performance.
        Parameters:
        overshootTileCache - the number of tiles to overshoot the tile cache by

      • getOvershootTileCache

        public int getOvershootTileCache()
        Get the tile cache overshoot value.
        Returns:
        the number of tiles to overshoot tile cache
